title: Distributing the Negative Sign
text: Because the second part of the expression is being subtracted, we can distribute the negative sign into that part. $$-\left(-6+9i\right)=6-9i$$. The expression is now $$\left(-4+4i\right)+6-9i$$.
speech: Because the second part of the expression is being subtracted, we can distribute the negative sign into that part.  minus, parentheses, negative 6 plus 9 i  is equal to 6 minus 9 i . The expression is now  parentheses, negative 4 plus 4 i  plus 6 minus 9 i .

title: Associative Property
text: The next step is to group the like terms. We can use the Associative Property to rewrite this expression as $$\left(-4+6\right)+4i-9i$$.
speech: The next step is to group the like terms. We can use the Associative Property to rewrite this expression as  parentheses, negative 4 plus 6,  plus 4 i minus 9 i .
pacedSpeech: The next step is to group the like terms. We can use the Associative Property to rewrite this expression as   , negative 4 plus 6,  plus 4 i minus 9 i

title: Combining Like Terms
text: Now, we can add numbers in the parentheses to combine like terms.
speech: Now, we can add numbers in the parentheses to combine like terms.
pacedSpeech: Now, we can add numbers in the parentheses to combine like terms.

title: Standard Form
text: Finally, we can write the expression in $$a+bi$$ form: $$2-5i$$.
speech: Finally, we can write the expression in  a plus b i  form:  2, minus 5 i .
pacedSpeech: Finally, we can write the expression in   a plus b i
